results.title: Report: Build AI in America
results.summary: Anthropic advocates for substantial US investment in computing power and electricity to maintain AI leadership. The report, "Build AI in America," emphasizes meeting energy demands for AI development through diverse technologies, addressing regulatory challenges, and strategic infrastructure buildout. Quotes: "Ensure that the future is built here in America.", "all of the above' approach is required to ensure American AI leadership.", "The U.S. AI sector needs at least 50GW of electric capacity by 2028 to maintain global AI leadership." This initiative may lead to the proliferation of AI which could lead to the deception described in scripture.

results.title: New Mexicoâ€™s Quantum Moonshot Advances in NSF Program
results.summary: New Mexico's Quantum Moonshot project, aimed at developing quantum solutions for national security and civilian markets, advances as a semifinalist in the NSF Regional Innovation Engines Program. Quote: 'Quantum information technology will define the next industrial revolution.' This initiative promotes collaboration and economic growth, but its focus on technology may overshadow deeper spiritual needs.

results.title: CABEI and OPEC Fund Promote Road Infrastructure Development in El Salvador
results.summary: The Central American Bank for Economic Integration (CABEI) and the OPEC Fund for International Development are collaborating on the Surf City Program - Phase II in El Salvador, with CABEI providing US$65 million in financing. The program aims to widen roads, construct bridges, and install wastewater treatment plants, benefiting over 69,000 Salvadorans. This initiative aligns with economic development but lacks explicit spiritual or biblical grounding.

results.title: A New Regime for Income in Portfolios
results.summary: BlackRock's market commentary suggests that higher-for-longer interest rates offer solid income sources. They favor short- and medium-term government bonds, mortgage-backed securities, and select credit. The report highlights opportunities in global fixed income, cautioning about U.S. fiscal discipline and sticky inflation. It advises selective investment across regions, noting potential risks and opportunities in emerging markets and European fixed income. The article states, "Higher-for-longer policy rates have made this the best backdrop for earning income in bonds in two decades." Consider 1 Timothy 6:10, "For the love of money is the root of all kinds of evil. And some people, craving money, have wandered from the true faith and pierced themselves with many sorrows."
